January 1917.SECRET.WAR CABINET, 35.Minutes of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10, Doitming Street, S.W., anTuesday, January 16, 1917, at 1T30 a.m.Present :The Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. A. Henderson, M.P.The Right Hon. the Earl Curzon of kedleston, K.G., G.C.S.I., G.C.I.E.The Right Hon. Viscount Milner, G.C.B.,G.C.M.G.The Right Hon. A. Bonar Law, M.P.In attendance:The Right Hon. A. J. Balfour, O.M.,M.P., Secretary of State for ForeignAffairs.Field-Marshal Sir Douglas Haig, G.C.B.,G.C.VO., K.C.I.E., Oommander-in-Ohief of the Expeditionary Force.General Sir W. R. Robertson, K.C.B.,K.C.V.O., D.S.O., Chief of the ImperialGeneral Staff.Major-General F. B. Maurice,. C.B.,Director of Military Operations.Brigadier-General J. H. Davidson, D.S.O.Lieut.-Colonel E. FrrzG. Dillon, D.S.O.H.E. M. Paul Cambon, French Am-bassaclor.General Nivelle, Commander-in-Chief ofthe French Armies of the North and north-We^t.M. A. de Fleuriau, Councillor of Embassy.Colonel de la Panouse, C.B., military attache.Lieutenant-Colonel d'Alancon.Commandant Bertier de Sauvtgny,D.S.O.Capitaiue de Suzannet.,Capitaine Guillaume.Lieutenant-Colonel Sir M. P. A. Hankey, K.C.B., SecretaryLieutenant-Colonel E. D. Swinton, D.S.O., R.E., Assistant Secretary.M. Mantoux, Interpreter.The Western Front. THE War Cabinet continued the discussion on the extent offront to be held respectively by the British and French Armies inFrance, General Nivelle (the Commandei-in-Chief of the french army on the Western front) and Field-Marshal Sir Douglas Haigbeing again present.An agreement was reached, and embodied in a document whichwas signed by the respective Commanders-in-Chief, and has beenretained by the Chief of the Imperial General Staff. A copy of thisagreement has been placed on record with the archives of the WarCabinet.(Initialled) D. LI. G.2, Whitehall (Jardens, S.W.,January 16, 1917.
